channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Most states that considered abortion rights amendments approved them
item.description: Ten states considered adding language guaranteeing abortion rights in their state constitutions during this year’s elections. Voters in seven of the states approved the ballot questions. Three rejected them.
item.content:encoded:
Ten states considered adding language guaranteeing abortion rights in their state constitutions during this year’s elections. Voters in seven of the states approved the ballot questions. Three rejected them.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Donald Trump has won the presidential election and will return to the White House
item.description: Becoming just the second president to be defeated and then reelected to a subsequent term, former President Donald Trump defeated Vice President Harris and will be the 47th president.
item.content:encoded:
Becoming just the second president to be defeated and then reelected to a subsequent term, former President Donald Trump defeated Vice President Harris and will be the 47th president.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Arizona voters pass constitutional amendment guaranteeing abortion access
item.description: Arizona’s 15-week abortion ban is expected to fall once the new constitutional amendment goes into effect. But there are dozens of other laws on the books regulating abortion.
item.content:encoded:
Arizona’s 15-week abortion ban is expected to fall once the new constitutional amendment goes into effect. But there are dozens of other laws on the books regulating abortion.

(Image credit: FREDERIC J. BROWN)
item.dc:creator: Katherine Davis-Young

item.title: Nebraska voters opt to keep 12-week abortion ban in place
item.description: Nebraska voters faced opposing abortion proposals on the ballot and chose to keep the state’s current law and enshrine it into the constitution.
item.content:encoded:
Nebraska voters faced opposing abortion proposals on the ballot and chose to keep the state’s current law and enshrine it into the constitution.

(Image credit: Bonnie Ryan)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rembert, Nebraska Public Media

item.title: Nevadans take first step to protecting abortion in state constitution
item.description: The proposal would guarantee abortion access until fetal viability and to protect the life of the pregnant person. It will need to pass again in 2026 to be fully approved.
item.content:encoded:
The proposal would guarantee abortion access until fetal viability and to protect the life of the pregnant person. It will need to pass again in 2026 to be fully approved.

(Image credit: Ronda Churchill)
item.dc:creator: Lucia Starbuck, KUNR Public Radio

item.title: Arizona voters approve GOP-backed immigration measure
item.description: It’s already illegal under federal law to cross into the United States outside of legal ports of entry. The Arizona measure would allow local police to arrest undocumented migrants.
item.content:encoded:
It’s already illegal under federal law to cross into the United States outside of legal ports of entry. The Arizona measure would allow local police to arrest undocumented migrants.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Ben Giles

item.title: South Dakota rejects effort to protect reproductive rights in the state constitution
item.description: South Dakota voters rejected an abortion rights amendment to the state constitution, according to a call by the Associated Press. Anti-abortion groups called the proposal ‘too extreme.’
item.content:encoded:
South Dakota voters rejected an abortion rights amendment to the state constitution, according to a call by the Associated Press. Anti-abortion groups called the proposal ‘too extreme.’

(Image credit: Jack Dura)
item.dc:creator: Lee Strubinger, South Dakota Public Broadcasting

item.title: Trump declares victory in White House race, ahead of AP call
item.description: Flanked by family and staff, Trump spoke to a convention center ballroom crowd in West Palm Beach after Fox News had projected that he had won — but before the Associated Press called the race.
item.content:encoded:
Flanked by family and staff, Trump spoke to a convention center ballroom crowd in West Palm Beach after Fox News had projected that he had won — but before the Associated Press called the race.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump wins Pennsylvania, delivering harsh blow to Harris campaign
item.description: Securing the state’s 19 electoral votes is a major victory for Trump and a major blow to Vice President Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Securing the state’s 19 electoral votes is a major victory for Trump and a major blow to Vice President Harris.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl

item.title: Former DACA recipient wins New Mexico legislative seat, making history
item.description: Cindy Nava came to the U.S. when she was 7 years old. She says she ran for the Albuquerque-area seat to boost political representation of the state's Hispanic-majority population.
item.content:encoded:
Cindy Nava came to the U.S. when she was 7 years old. She says she ran for the Albuquerque-area seat to boost political representation of the state's Hispanic-majority population.

(Image credit: Morgan Lee)
item.dc:creator: Taylor Velasquez, KUNM
